Descriptor.0: ssies> Special Sensors-Ions, Electrons, and Scintillation thermal plasma analysis package

PI_name.0: William Hanson, Rod Heelis, Marc Hairston

PI_affiliation.0: University of Texas Dallas, Center for Space Sciences

TEXT.0: The Special Sensors-Ions, Electrons, and Scintillation (SSIES) thermal plasma analysis package is a suite of instruments built by the Center for Space Sciences at the University of Texas at Dallas and flown on a number of the DMSP satellites. SSIESS includes a Retarding Potential Analyzer (RPA), Ion Drift meter (IDM), scintillation meter, and Langmuir probe.

Mission_group.1: !___ITM Data including Earth Imaging and Ground-Based

Generated_by.0: Marc Hairston and William R Coley

Acknowledgement.0: We gratefully acknowledge the University of Texas Dallas, Center for Space Sciences and the US Air Force for providing the DMSP thermal plasma data

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Default time
Vx - median filtered and smoothed ion flow in the ram direction

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: median filtered and smoothed ion flow in the ram direction from the fits to the RPA curve

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> Vx quality flag [READ QUALITY FLAG Document: link below]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1-good 2-fair 3-caution 4-bad 5-uncertain

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> Vx root mean square of the RPA fit

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: root mean square of the fit to the RPA curve giving an indication of the quality of the RPA data for this sweep

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Vx - original unfiltered Vx flow

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: the unfiltered Vx flow values calculated by the RPA fitting routine

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Vy - ion flow in the horizontal crosstrack direction

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: crosstrack horizontal ion flow from IDM, positive is in the sunward direction regardless of the orientation of the orbit, data taken in two modes: normal and slow (see nmbpts)

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> quality flag for Vy data [READ QUALITY FLAG Document: link below]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1-good 2-fair 3-caution 4-bad 5-uncertain 6-good (F17) 7-fair (F17) 8-caution (F17) 9-caution (sun glint or high-energy particles)

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> standard deviation of the Vy flow

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: standard deviation of the six Vy samples taken per second in the normal mode, fill data in slow mode

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> roughness parameter of Vy

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: roughness parameter of Vy defined as (delta Vy / averaged Vy)

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Vz - ion flow in the vertical crosstrack direction

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: crosstrack vertical ion flow from IDM, positive is in the upward direction, data taken in two modes: normal and slow (see nmbpts)

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> quality flag for Vz data [READ QUALITY FLAG Document: link below]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1-good 2-fair 3-caution 4-bad 5-uncertain 6-good (F17) 7-fair (F17) 8-caution (F17) 9-caution (sun glint or high-energy particles)

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> standard deviation of the Vz flow

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: standard deviation of the six Vz samples taken per second in the normal mode, fill data in slow mode

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> roughness parameter of Vz (delta Vz / averaged Vz)

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: roughness parameter of Vy defined as (delta Vy / averaged Vy)

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ion temperature

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: temperature of the ions in the plasma calculated from the fit to the RPA curve

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> Quality flag for the ion temperature [READ QUALITY FLAG Document: link below]

VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: Quality flag for the ion temperature

VarAttributes.LABLAXIS: Quality flag for the ion temperature

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1-good 2-fair 3-caution 4-bad 5-uncertain

VarAttributes.CATDESC: electron temperature

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: the electron temperature based on an onboard calculation of the Langmuir probe sweep which occurs once every 4 s

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Ni calculated from the RPA

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Ion density of the plasma calculated from the fit to the RPA curve

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> quality flag for the ion density [READ QUALITY FLAG Document: link below]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1-good 2-fair 3-caution 4-bad 5-uncertain

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Ni from scintillation meter

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: the average of the 24 Hz samples of the ion density by the scintillation meter, because of its large aperture this is considered the best meaure of the ion density

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> roughness parameter of SM density

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: roughness parameter of scintillation meter ion density  defined as (delta Ni/ averaged Ni)

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Ni measured from the RPA at 0 volts

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: during each RPA sweep there is a point where the repeller voltage is 0 V so all the ions reach the collector, this is the ion density based on that measurement

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Ni from the IDM

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: the ion density based on the collector current in the IDM, because some or all of the light ions are excluded this density should always be equal to or less than the other ion densities

VarAttributes.CATDESC: fractional amount of H+ ions in plasma

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: fractional amount of the plasma that is H+ based on the fitting of the RPA curve, because of uncertainties the value can exceed 1.0; disregard > 1.05 and negative

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> quality flag for fractional H+ [READ QUALITY FLAG Document: link below]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1-good 2-fair 3-caution 4-bad 5-uncertain

VarAttributes.CATDESC: fractional amount of He+ ions in plasma

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: fractional amount of the plasma that is He+ based on the fitting of the RPA curve, because of uncertainties the value can exceed 1.0; disregard > 1.05 and negative

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> quality flag for fractional He+ [READ QUALITY FLAG Document: link below]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1-good 2-fair 3-caution 4-bad 5-uncertain

VarAttributes.CATDESC: fractional amount of O+ ions in plasma

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: fractional amount of the plasma that is O+ based on the fitting of the RPA curve, because of uncertainties the value can exceed 1.0; disregard > 1.05 and negative

VarAttributes.CATDESC: ----> quality flag for fractional O+ [READ QUALITY FLAG Document: link below]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1-good 2-fair 3-caution 4-bad 5-uncertain

VarAttributes.CATDESC: electron background monitor - high energy particle currents detected by the RPA

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: once every 2 s the RPA repeller voltage is set so high that only high energy electrons or ions reach the collector. A large current indicates high-energy particles or photo-electron production (a sun-glint).

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Overall quality flag for RPA data [READ QUALITY FLAG Document: link below]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1-good 2-fair 3-caution 4-bad 5-uncertain

VarAttributes.CATDESC: flag for RPA sweep direction [READ QUALITY FLAG Document: link below]

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1-retarding potential increasing 2-retarding potential decreasing

VarAttributes.CATDESC: geographical latitude

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: geographic latitude of s/c

VarAttributes.CATDESC: geographic east longitude

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: geographic east longitude of s/c

VarAttributes.CATDESC: magnetic latitude, mapped to 120 km

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: magnetic latitude of field line at s/c mapped to 120 km

VarAttributes.CATDESC: magnetic local time, mapped to 120 km

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: magnetic local time of field line at s/c mapped to 120 km

VarAttributes.CATDESC: solar zenith angle

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: angle between the sun-earth line and the s/c-center of earth line

VarAttributes.CATDESC: altitude

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: altitude of the s/c above earth’s surface

VarAttributes.CATDESC: [Labels on plots] magnetic latitude, mapped to 120 km

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: magnetic latitude of field line at s/c mapped to 120 km

VarAttributes.CATDESC: [Labels on plots] magnetic local time, mapped to 120 km

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: magnetic local time of field line at s/c mapped to 120 km

VarAttributes.CATDESC: [Labels on plots] geographical latitude

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: geographic latitude of s/c

VarAttributes.CATDESC: [Labels on plots] geographic east longitude

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: geographic east longitude of s/c

VarAttributes.CATDESC: [Labels on plots] solar zenith angle

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: angle between the sun-earth line and the s/c-center of earth line

VarAttributes.CATDESC: [Labels on plots] altitude

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: altitude of the s/c above earth’s surface

VarAttributes.CATDESC: number of data points in the Vy - Vz average

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: the IDM operates in two modes: normal mode takes six horizontal and six vertical samples per second, slow mode is for low density conditions where only one sample is taken each second and alternates between directions

VarAttributes.CATDESC: overall quality flag for the IDM data [READ QUALITY FLAG Document: link below]

VarAttributes.FIELDNAM: overall quality flag for the IDM data

VarAttributes.LABLAXIS: overall quality flag for the IDM data

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: 1-good 2-fair 3-caution 4-bad 5-uncertain 6-good (F17) 7-fair (F17) 8-caution (F17) 9-caution (sun glint or high-energy particles)

VarAttributes.CATDESC: spacecraft velocity

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: orbital velocity of the spacecraft

VarAttributes.CATDESC: potential difference between SSIES instruments and spacecraft ground

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: the DMSP spacecraft charges negative relative to the plasma ground so SSIES is electrically insolated and driven positive relative to spacecraft ground to keep the instrument near the plasma ground

VarAttributes.CATDESC: potential of the SSIES instruments relative to the plasma ground

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: all the SSIES instruments are held near the plasma ground potential, nominally about -1 V relative to the plasma, this value is calculated from the RPA curve fit, shown as \“SC Potential\” on the plots

VarAttributes.CATDESC: north component of Earths magnetic field (IGRF)

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: northward component of the Earths magnetic field at the spacecrafts location calculated by the IGRF model

VarAttributes.CATDESC: east component of Earths magnetic field (IGRF)

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: eastward component of the Earths magnetic field at the spacecrafts location calculated by the IGRF model

VarAttributes.CATDESC: vertical downward component of Earths magnetic field (IGRF)

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: vertical downward component of the Earths magnetic field at the spacecrafts location calculated by the IGRF model

VarAttributes.CATDESC: corotation velocity of ionosphere in the ram direction

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: the ram component (x) of the corotation speed of the ionosphere at the spacecrafts location

VarAttributes.CATDESC: corotation velocity of ionosphere in the horizontal crosstrack direction

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: the crosstrack horizontal component (y) of the corotation speed of the ionosphere at the spacecrafts location

VarAttributes.CATDESC: corotation velocity of ionosphere in the vertical direction

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: the crosstrack vertical component (z) of the corotation speed of the ionosphere at the spacecrafts location, since DMSP is in a circular orbit, this value is zero
